citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
There were two bottles of expired medication found in the controlled drug inventory at one location. One medication
expired in March 2023, and the other in May 2023. Expired medications might have unpredictable efficacy and are not
appropriate methods of treatment. All expired medications should be properly disposed of by 4 August 2023.
Stallion #1 was noted to be lame on 28 July 2023. The animal caretakers initiated medical treatment on this animal
without consulting any member of the veterinary staff for a diagnosis or treatment options. The stallion was treated for
three days before being examined by a veterinarian on 31 July 2023.
Medical treatment without veterinary guidance could be ineffective or inappropriate, and might lead to worsening of the
animal's condition. Medical treatment of regulated animals should not be conducted without instruction from a licensed
veterinarian, or an existing treatment protocol approved by veterinary staff.
Correct by 4 August 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.33(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
There were two bottles of expired medication found in the controlled drug inventory at one location. One medication 
expired in March 2023, and the other in May 2023. Expired medications might have unpredictable efficacy and are not 
appropriate methods of treatment. All expired medications should be properly disposed of by 4 August 2023. 
 
Stallion #1 was noted to be lame on 28 July 2023. The animal caretakers initiated medical treatment on this animal 
without consulting any member of the veterinary staff for a diagnosis or treatment options. The stallion was treated for 
three days before being examined by a veterinarian on 31 July 2023.  
Medical treatment without veterinary guidance could be ineffective or inappropriate, and might lead to worsening of the 
animal's condition. Medical treatment of regulated animals should not be conducted without instruction from a licensed 
veterinarian, or an existing treatment protocol approved by veterinary staff. 
Correct by 4 August 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
